meanings.sent1: She always chooses the poncier outfits for special occasions.
meanings.sent2: The mansion on the hill looked even poncier with its golden gates.
meanings.sent3: His poncier manners made everyone giggle at the dinner party.
meanings.sent4: The poncier decorations at the event were like a fancy dream.
meanings.sent5: The poncier music playing in the background set a sophisticated tone.

meanings.definition: A person who is affectedly refined or pretentious.
meanings.sent1: The new student was labeled as a poncier by his classmates.
meanings.sent2: She acted like a poncier, always talking about expensive brands.
meanings.sent3: The poncier at the party stood out with their extravagant attire.
meanings.sent4: He was known as the office poncier for his snobbish attitude.
meanings.sent5: The group of ponciers gathered at the exclusive club every weekend.
